body.raw:
## Vietnamese

Năm ngoái giờ này mình còn đang ở Hồ Tây, ngày ngày đi học rồi làm, chiều đến vẫn đi tập Yoga đều đặn, có độ còn tập đến 2 lần một ngày. Lần nào đi cũng gật đầu chào bác bảo vệ ở quán cà phê gần đấy. Bác thỉnh thoảng lại nói với “Thích nhỉ, suối ngày được đi tập”, mình chẳng nói gì chỉ cười trừ. Anh bán bánh mì cũng cười chào “Em à”. 

Năm ngoái còn Molly, Molly đợt đấy biết sủa rồi, cũng không chịu để cho mình đi đâu 1 mình nữa. Nên có đợt rét lắm, vẫn phải ôm nhau ra quán cà phê ngồi để cho nó ra ngoài chơi 1 chút. 

Năm ngoái còn Tạ Coffee, mình vẫn ra đấy mỗi ngày, ngồi từ sáng đến chiều mới chịu về, cắm mặt vào máy tính viết ba dòng code chẳng hiểu gì, nhưng thế mà cũng ra được 1 cái website.

Năm ngoái còn mẹ, giờ này thì chắc mẹ ngủ rồi. Nhưng thường mỗi ngày mẹ đi chợ, rồi lại về vườn làm, lại trông nhà. Nói chung lúc nào cũng bận bịu. Đợt lạnh thì mẹ ít đi chợ hơn. Giá mà mình về nhà nhiều hơn. 

Hôm cuối năm ngồi xem lại ảnh mà tim cứ thắt chặt lại. Có lần mẹ bảo “Chúng mày là con gái thì thường thương bố hơn”. Mình chẳng nói gì cả. Giờ có muốn nói thương mẹ nhiều hơn cũng không được. Có ai đâu ngờ 1 sáng mở mắt lại là đứa mồ côi. 


<Image
  src="../blogs/lastyear4.jpeg"
  width="718"
  height="404"
  alt="Image"
  sizes="100vw"
/>

<Image
  src="../blogs/lastyear2.jpeg"
  width="718"
  height="404"
  alt="Image"
  sizes="100vw"
/>




## English

Last year, around this time, I was living near West Lake, attending school and work every day, and still going to yoga in the afternoons—sometimes even twice a day. I walked past the security guard at the nearby coffee shop every day,  nodded and greeted him. Occasionally, he would say to me, "I wish I could be like you, going to the gym every day." I never replied, just smiled. There was a baker who would also greet me warmly, calling me "Honey."

Last year, Molly was still around. By then, He had learned to bark and wouldn’t let me go anywhere alone. Even on the coldest days, we would bundle up, hug each other for warmth, and head to the coffee shop so he could play outside for a little while.

Last year, Ta Coffee was still there. I used to go there every day, sitting from morning until afternoon before heading home. I would bury my face in my computer, writing a few lines of code I barely understood, yet somehow managing to create a website.

Last year, Mom was still with us. By this time in the evening—around 8:30 p.m.—she would probably already be asleep. But during the day, she was always busy: going to the market, working in the garden, or tending to the house. During the colder days, she went to the market less often. I wish I had visited home more frequently.

At the end of the year, I found myself looking at old photos, and my heart ached. My mother once said, "You girls usually love your father more." I didn’t respond. Now, even if I wanted to tell her I loved her more, I couldn’t. Who would have thought that one morning I’d wake up and realize I was an orphan. 

<Image
  src="../blogs/lastyear3.jpeg"
  width="718"
  height="404"
  alt="Image"
  sizes="100vw"
/>

`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"N\u0103m ngo\xE1i c\xF2n Molly, Molly \u0111\u1EE3t \u0111\u1EA5y bi\u1EBFt s\u1EE7a r\u1ED3i, c\u0169ng kh\xF4ng ch\u1ECBu \u0111\u1EC3 cho m\xECnh \u0111i \u0111\xE2u 1 m\xECnh n\u1EEFa. N\xEAn c\xF3 \u0111\u1EE3t r\xE9t l\u1EAFm, v\u1EABn ph\u1EA3i \xF4m nhau ra qu\xE1n c\xE0 ph\xEA ng\u1ED3i \u0111\u1EC3 cho n\xF3 ra ngo\xE0i ch\u01A1i 1 ch\xFAt."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:19,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"N\u0103m ngo\xE1i c\xF2n T\u1EA1 Coffee, m\xECnh v\u1EABn ra \u0111\u1EA5y m\u1ED7i ng\xE0y, ng\u1ED3i t\u1EEB s\xE1ng \u0111\u1EBFn chi\u1EC1u m\u1EDBi ch\u1ECBu v\u1EC1, c\u1EAFm m\u1EB7t v\xE0o m\xE1y t\xEDnh vi\u1EBFt ba d\xF2ng code ch\u1EB3ng hi\u1EC3u g\xEC, nh\u01B0ng th\u1EBF m\xE0 c\u0169ng ra \u0111\u01B0\u1EE3c 1 c\xE1i website."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:21,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"N\u0103m ngo\xE1i c\xF2n m\u1EB9, gi\u1EDD n\xE0y th\xEC ch\u1EAFc m\u1EB9 ng\u1EE7 r\u1ED3i. Nh\u01B0ng th\u01B0\u1EDDng m\u1ED7i ng\xE0y m\u1EB9 \u0111i ch\u1EE3, r\u1ED3i l\u1EA1i v\u1EC1 v\u01B0\u1EDDn l\xE0m, l\u1EA1i tr\xF4ng nh\xE0. N\xF3i chung l\xFAc n\xE0o c\u0169ng b\u1EADn b\u1ECBu. \u0110\u1EE3t l\u1EA1nh th\xEC m\u1EB9 \xEDt \u0111i ch\u1EE3 h\u01A1n. Gi\xE1 m\xE0 m\xECnh v\u1EC1 nh\xE0 nhi\u1EC1u h\u01A1n."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:23,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"H\xF4m cu\u1ED1i n\u0103m ng\u1ED3i xem l\u1EA1i \u1EA3nh m\xE0 tim c\u1EE9 th\u1EAFt ch\u1EB7t l\u1EA1i. C\xF3 l\u1EA7n m\u1EB9 b\u1EA3o \u201CCh\xFAng m\xE0y l\xE0 con g\xE1i th\xEC th\u01B0\u1EDDng th\u01B0\u01A1ng b\u1ED1 h\u01A1n\u201D. M\xECnh ch\u1EB3ng n\xF3i g\xEC c\u1EA3. Gi\u1EDD c\xF3 mu\u1ED1n n\xF3i th\u01B0\u01A1ng m\u1EB9 nhi\u1EC1u h\u01A1n c\u0169ng kh\xF4ng \u0111\u01B0\u1EE3c. C\xF3 ai \u0111\xE2u ng\u1EDD 1 s\xE1ng m\u1EDF m\u1EAFt l\u1EA1i l\xE0 \u0111\u1EE9a m\u1ED3 c\xF4i."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:25,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.h2,{id:"english",children:["English",(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.a,{"aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",href:"#english",children:(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx"},this)]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:47,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:'Last year, around this time, I was living near West Lake, attending school and work every day, and still going to yoga in the afternoons\u2014sometimes even twice a day. I walked past the security guard at the nearby coffee shop every day,  nodded and greeted him. Occasionally, he would say to me, "I wish I could be like you, going to the gym every day." I never replied, just smiled. There was a baker who would also greet me warmly, calling me "Honey."'},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:49,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"Last year, Molly was still around. By then, He had learned to bark and wouldn\u2019t let me go anywhere alone. Even on the coldest days, we would bundle up, hug each other for warmth, and head to the coffee shop so he could play outside for a little while."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:51,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"Last year, Ta Coffee was still there. I used to go there every day, sitting from morning until afternoon before heading home. I would bury my face in my computer, writing a few lines of code I barely understood, yet somehow managing to create a website."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:53,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:"Last year, Mom was still with us. By this time in the evening\u2014around 8:30 p.m.\u2014she would probably already be asleep. But during the day, she was always busy: going to the market, working in the garden, or tending to the house. During the colder days, she went to the market less often. I wish I had visited home more frequently."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:55,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,u.jsxDEV)(a.p,{children:'At the end of the year, I found myself looking at old photos, and my heart ached. My mother once said, "You girls usually love your father more." I didn\u2019t respond. Now, even if I wanted to tell her I loved her more, I couldn\u2019t. Who would have thought that one morning I\u2019d wake up and realize I was an orphan.'},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/wendywendy/Documents/Personal Project/callmelaura/content/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7c91d39f-0e4b-4220-9ade-f59cac1bb30e.mdx",lineNumber:57,columnNumber:1},this),`
